newsitem.title: USA: Arbor Software, Mitsubishi software pact.
newsitem.headline: Arbor Software, Mitsubishi software pact.

text.p: Arbor Software Corp. said Wednesday it agreed to let a division of Mitsubishi Corp. distribute its database software in Japan, in a pact that could expand its business oversees.

The companies said Mitsubishi's Sirius Inc. software distribution unit will sell Arbor's Essbase business analysis software on behalf of Arbor. Mitsubishi also will help install the complex software at customer sites, the companies said.

The move will help Arbor, based in Sunnyvale, California, establish itself in the Japanese market for so-called data warehousing software, which is expected to triple from about $400 million now to about $1.4 billion by the year 2000, the company said.
"We've been working on developing the Asia- Pacific marketplace for 18 months, and we clearly feel we found the best partner," said James Dorrian, Arbor chief executive.
Mitsubishi's goal is to sell about $13 million worth of Arbor software by October 1998, said Osamu Akamareu, executive vice president at Sirius.
